climbs.name: Whiptail
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Nathan Mitts & Pete Paredes, July 2001

content.description:
The right side of Motherlode Rock's north face is home to this fine route up the striking northwest arete, which from the west looks like the head of a giant lizard.

Start in a shallow right-facing corner around and right from

Smackdown

and climb up and slightly left to a stance atop a pillar. Above the pillar the climb goes slightly right to gain the arete proper which goes slabby after a few moves and leads to the base of a short headwall. The next moves are the crux and involve moving off a good left hand in a shallow corner as your right hand pinches the arete to gain a horizontal (the Lizard's mouth) and then the anchors (these last moves are somewhat reachy).

Good exposure, enjoyable movement and quality rock make this a route to seek out on this portion of Motherlode Rock.
content.location: Right side of the north face on the obvious sharp arete.

climbs.name: Smackdown
climbs.fa: Pete Paredes, Nathan Mitts, Ted Peace, Diane Peace & Chris Miller, July 2001

content.description:
Climb a short vertical face (crux) which quickly slabs out at the second bolt. From here the climb wanders up the slab to a steep finish, which involves handrailing out right along a horizontal crack to a shared anchor with Whiptail.

The name comes from a slab-smacking fall, which earned a fractured ankle, by one of the members of the FA party.
content.location:
Locate this route on the right side of the north face - just left of

Whiptail

on a slabby section of rock.

content.description:
The first half of this route involves slab climbing past two bolts which leads to a short but gently overhanging headwall where the crux is to be found.

A sequential series of moves past the third bolt gain the last bolt and the crux, which involves a strenuous lieback to gain a jug, and then the anchors.

There's a bit of rope drag on the lip so it's best to rap off as opposed to lowering.
content.location:
Found in a recessed area just right of

Nitroglycerine

and a short ways left of

Smackdown

.

content.description:
Start on Powder Keg, work your way up through the first 2 bolts, match the jug and traverse right over the outcropping and pull the Crux on Nitro G.

Heel hook and compression your way across the lip.

Up a slippery slab to some good holds under the roof and then power out the somewhat reachy roof with a wild sequence to finish on easy slab to anchors - fun!

One of the first lines on the Motherlode Wall, this was orignally done with just two bolts (the second and third) and no anchors but later retro-bolted to make a popular and often done route.
content.protection:
4 bolts, bolted anchor (shared with Nitroglycerine)

(all bolts 1/2" SS)

Bolts replaced 2019
content.location:
Left side of the north face and easily identified as a slab to corner capped by a roof.

Nitroglycerine

is just to the right on the arete.

content.description:
Easy slab climbing leads to a high first bolt under a small roof, where the tricky crux is found. After the crux the climbing eases and continues up the slabby arete past two more bolts to a final bolt that's shared with the route

Powder Keg

just to the left.
content.protection:
4 bolts, chain anchor (shared with Powder Keg)

(all bolts 1/2" SS)

* Bolts replaced 2019
content.location:
The arete just right of

Powder Keg

.

content.description:
This is the finger crack corner between Nitroglycerine and Short Fuse. Start up arete of Nitro to overhang, then climb up right into corner. Avoid dirt and plants. Up into corner finger crack and over the top. Two anchors exist, one left (better pull), one right (better if rapping off/single climb).

Fun.

Please inform me of the name/details of the route if you have the info.
content.protection:
-Small cams to .75

-Single set offset alloy nuts
content.location: This is the finger crack corner between Nitroglycerine and Short Fuse.

content.description:
Bolted route left of

Short Fuse

, slab climbing with a smear crux near the top around the 8th bolt. A great warm-up or first lead.
content.protection:
10 bolts, anchors

(all bolts 1/2" SS)

* Bolts replaced 2019
content.location: In between "Short Fuse" and "Smackdown"..rap or lower.

content.description: Start up a broken arete and stem/chimney up onto a slab bordered by a steep left wall. Continue up the slab to where the corner steepens and stem/lieback your way to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts, bolted anchor with Mussy hooks
content.location:
Located between

Nitroglycerine

and

Short Fuse

.
